agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that is dedicated to meeting the needs of the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community and those questioning their sexual orientation and gender identity.
service_description: Provides confidential telephone and online peer counseling and local resources for young persons who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) as well as young people who are questioning their sexual orientation or gender identity. Maintains information about local resources such as LGBT-friendly support groups, social organizations, churches, employers, health care, legal services, and more.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, send an email, or visit the website for assistance.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that is dedicated to meeting the needs of the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community and those questioning their sexual orientation and gender identity.
service_description: Provides confidential telephone and online peer counseling, information, and local resources for persons who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender (LGBT) of all ages, as well as persons questioning their sexual orientation or gender identity. Maintains information about local resources such as LGBT-friendly restaurants, churches, employers, health care, legal services, and more.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, email, visit the website and chat online.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers eyecare program to those in need.
service_description: Nationwide program provides referrals to free,  glaucoma eye exams and initial treatment (if necessary) for uninsured persons who are at increased risk of glaucoma and who have not had an eye exam within the past 12 months. Risk assessment is based on age, race, and family history of glaucoma. Also offers resource material on eye diseases.
site_details: Visit website to take an online referral questionnaire to determine eligibility. -- Eligible candidates will receive a letter in the mail within 2 weeks with referral information. Ineligible candidates will be notified upon completion of the online questionnaire.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon (Hours of operation are Pacific Time)
site_eligibility: US citizens or legal residents -- Not had an eye exam in 12 months or more -- At increased risk of glaucoma based on age, race, or family history of glaucoma -- Not insured through an HMO or receiving veteran's eye-care benefits

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers eyecare program to those in need.
service_description: Nationwide program refers seniors (age 65 or older) to local ophthalmologists who provide medical eye exams and up to one year of care for conditions diagnosed at the initial exam. Doctors' services are provided at no out-of-pocket cost to the patient. Other related costs (such as eyeglasses, prescriptions, or hospital services) are not covered.
site_details: Visit website to take an online referral questionnaire to determine eligibility. -- Eligible candidates will receive a letter in the mail within 2 weeks with referral information.   Ineligible candidates will be notified upon completion of the online questionnaire.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon (Hours of operation are Pacific Time)
site_eligibility: US citizens or legal residents --Age 65 or older -- Not seen an eye doctor (ophthalmologist) in 3 years or more -- Does not belong to an HMO and does not receive eye care benefits through the VA
